awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Brazil Planning Visit to Discuss Collaboration on      Systematics of Euphorbiaceae
awd_abstract_narration: 9424517  Webster        This U.S.-Brazil Program award will fund a planning visit by  Dr. Grady L. Webster of the University of California, Davis  to discuss collaboration on systematics of Euphorbiaceae  with botanists in Brazil.  Dr. Webster is linking this visit  to the XLVI Congresso Nacional de Botanica in Riberao Preto,  Sao Paulo, Brazil.  He will stay on to meet with colleagues  at Instituto Botanico in Sao Paulo and at Museu Municipal in  Curitiba.  An informal conference will be held to discuss  collaboration in preparing a systematic treatment of the  Euphorbiaceae of Brasil, as a possible precursor to a new  Flora Brasiliensis that will include all vascular plant  families.  The 60 genera with c. 900 species of Brasilian  Euphorbiaceae include species of biogegraphic and  evolutionary interest, and the wild forms of important  economic plants such as Hevea (rubber) and Manihot  (cassava).                                  ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
